intro: Genoplesium parvicallum, commonly known as the small-callus orchid, is a terrestrial herbaceous plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has a short, hairy stem and produces small, greenish-white flowers with a distinctive labellum. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
